N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 541.5 - Administrative privileges

State Regulations
(a) Administrative privileges allowing a defendant to leave the buildings to which
he or she is restricted but not the facility, while under the constant
supervision of one or more facility employees, may be granted by the clinical
director, after consultation with the hospital forensics committee as required
by section
541.9
of this Part. (b) Unescorted administrative privileges
allowing a defendant to leave the buildings to which he or she is restricted
but not the facility without the constant supervision of one or more facility
employees, may be granted by the clinical director after consultation with the
hospital forensics committee. (c) Administrative privileges authorizing a defendant to leave the confines of the
facility for the purpose of receiving medical care, appearing in court or
attending the funeral of an immediate family member, while under the constant
supervision of one or more employees of the facility, may be granted by the

Director of Forensic Services upon the recommendation of the clinical director. Such authorization may be obtained by telephone and does not require prior
discussion by the hospital forensics committee. Notes
